questions.html: What is the difference between static and dynamic CMOS logic styles?

choices.html: Static CMOS logic style does not have any dynamic node in the circuit and it is preferred for designs with less noise sensitivity. Dynamic CMOS logic style has dynamic node and it is preferred for high speed applications.
choices.reason: Correct, this is the main difference between static and dynamic CMOS logic styles.

choices.html: Static CMOS logic style is faster than dynamic CMOS logic style. Dynamic CMOS logic style is slower but more power efficient.
choices.reason: Incorrect, this is not the main difference between static and dynamic CMOS logic styles.

choices.html: Static CMOS logic style is used in high-speed applications and dynamic CMOS logic style is used in low-power applications.
choices.reason: Incorrect, this is not the main difference between static and dynamic CMOS logic styles.

choices.html: Static CMOS logic style uses only NMOS transistors while dynamic CMOS logic style uses both NMOS and PMOS transistors.
choices.reason: Incorrect, this is not the main difference between static and dynamic CMOS logic styles.

questions.html: What is meant by 'fan-in' and 'fan-out' in digital circuits?

choices.html: Fan-in refers to the number of inputs to a gate, and fan-out refers to the number of gates that a gate can drive
choices.reason: This is the correct definition of fan-in and fan-out

choices.html: Fan-in refers to the number of gates that a gate can drive, and fan-out refers to the number of inputs to a gate
choices.reason: This definition is incorrect

choices.html: Fan-in refers to the number of outputs of a gate, and fan-out refers to the number of gates that a gate can drive
choices.reason: This definition is incorrect

choices.html: Fan-in refers to the number of gates that a gate can drive, and fan-out refers to the number of outputs of a gate
choices.reason: This definition is incorrect

questions.html: Which is not a component of the basic CMOS logic gate?

choices.html: Diode
choices.reason: Diodes can be used in CMOS gates for various functions such as ESD protection, but they are not a component of the basic CMOS inverter gate

choices.html: N-type MOSFET
choices.reason: N-type MOSFET is one of the two transistors (the other being P-type) used in CMOS gates

choices.html: BJT
choices.reason: BJT (Bipolar Junction Transistor) is not used in CMOS gates

choices.html: P-type MOSFET
choices.reason: P-type MOSFET is one of the two transistors (the other being N-type) used in CMOS gates

questions.html: Which of the following is not a basic logic gate?

choices.html: AND gate
choices.reason: AND gate is a basic logic gate

choices.html: OR gate
choices.reason: OR gate is a basic logic gate

choices.html: XOR gate
choices.reason: XOR gate is not a basic logic gate

choices.html: NOT gate
choices.reason: NOT gate is a basic logic gate

choices.reason: The fan-out of a gate in a CMOS circuit can be greater than 1
The fan-out of a gate in a CMOS circuit can be greater than 2

choices.html: Depends on the technology

choices.reason: Adder circuit is used to add two numbers and perform other arithmetic operations

choices.html: To store data temporarily

choices.reason: An adder circuit is not used to provide power to the CPU

choices.reason: An adder circuit is not used to connect different components of the CPU

questions.html: What is the difference between a latch and a flip-flop?

choices.html: A flip-flop is edge-triggered, while a latch is level-triggered
choices.reason: This is the correct difference between a latch and a flip-flop.

choices.html: A latch is edge-triggered, while a flip-flop is level-triggered

questions.html: What is the typical size range of a transistor in modern VLSI technologies?

choices.html: 1 micron to 10 microns

choices.html: 100 nanometers to 1 micron

questions.html: What is the difference between an ASIC and an FPGA?

choices.html: An ASIC is custom-built for a specific application, while an FPGA is a programmable device
choices.reason: Correct, an ASIC is Application-Specific Integrated Circuit, it is designed for a specific application, while an FPGA is a Field-Programmable Gate Array, it is a programmable device

choices.html: An ASIC is a programmable device, while an FPGA is custom-built for a specific application
choices.reason: Incorrect, this is the opposite of what ASIC and FPGA are

choices.html: There is no difference, ASIC and FPGA are interchangeable
choices.reason: Incorrect, ASIC and FPGA are different types of devices

choices.html: The difference in arrival times of the clock signal at different points in a circuit
choices.reason: Correct, clock skew is the difference in arrival times of the clock signal at different points in a circuit

choices.html: The amount of jitter in the clock signal
choices.reason: Incorrect, clock skew is not the same as clock jitter

choices.html: The delay introduced by the clock distribution network
choices.reason: Incorrect, this is not the definition of clock skew

choices.html: The difference between the clock frequency and the data rate
choices.reason: Incorrect, this is not related to clock skew
